comment: Professor Smith great! He's a funny guy and I really enjoyed his class. I would recommend studying for the tests though because they can be tough. However, the same questions are on pretty much all of them. He is a pretty easy grader too on your projects so don't sweat them. Don't really need the book other than for the academic integrity statement

3 tests, a speech, a group project, and a few book assignments. Very, very easy. Read the book and do your work. Study for the tests, he likes to ask things from both lecture and the text. He is pretty funny, he likes when you get involved in lectures. He's a fair grader, you get what you worked fordeserve.
Awesome teacher! Very understanding about not being in class or turning in late assignments. Easy A if you study the study guide. He makes lectures interesting. Would recommend him to anyone

He's so chill. Love that about him. His first two tests are hard. Don't worry his study guide is the exam word for word, the questions are even in the same order. He gave me a 100 even though I wasn't even close to making it to 7 minutes on my speech. He's a funny guy. Seriously take him, you get out early a lot.
Ridiculously easy class, and quite frankly the material is BS. Mr. Smith is somewhat boring but tries his best to make the class interesting, and easy as well.

Great guy. Pretty much wanting to hand everyone an A. As long as you do your work he is going to be pretty reasonable with you.  If you are borderline on your final grade he will most likely bump you up. Over all great teacher!
Good teacher, nice person...just do your homework and you'll pass.
Pretty good professor.  If you do the work you'll get an easy A.  He curves the tests and practically hands you an A if he can.  Overall good teacher.

He's an extremely chill dude. At the beginning of the semester there's a lot of useless work, but it's easy. He like to discuss about things irrelevant to the class..but then again the class is irrelevant to life. I would take him. He curves grades and grades easily on presentations.
